meanings.definition: To fill or take up (space or time)
meanings.sent1: Books and toys occupy the shelves in the room.
meanings.sent2: The students occupy their time with homework and games.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces occupy the table, waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent4: Laughter and joy occupy every corner of the house during the holidays.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons occupy the sky, creating a festive atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Birds occupy the nest in the tree outside.
meanings.sent2: Families occupy the houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin in the woods is occupied by a friendly bear.
meanings.sent4: Peace and tranquility occupy the small town by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse occupies a special place in the hearts of the locals.

meanings.definition: To engage or be employed in
meanings.sent1: Children occupy themselves with drawing and coloring.
meanings.sent2: Workers occupy various roles in the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat occupies its time by chasing shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Passion and dedication occupy the hearts of artists.
meanings.sent5: Curiosity and wonder occupy the minds of young explorers.

meanings.definition: To seize or take control of (a place)
meanings.sent1: The army plans to occupy the enemy's territory.
meanings.sent2: The rebels aim to occupy the government building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons occupy the backyard at night.
meanings.sent4: Fear and uncertainty occupy the minds of those facing a crisis.
meanings.sent5: Darkness and shadows occupy the abandoned mansion, giving it an eerie feel.
